<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 18"
    pfs=""
>
[Genius Diadem](/Equipment.aspx?ID=595)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Apex" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=10" />
<trait label="Arcane" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=11" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Intelligent" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=280" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 89</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn circlet

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Perception** +22; precise vision 30 feet, imprecise hearing 30 feet, constant [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66)

**Communication** speech ([Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), and eight other common languages)

**Skills** [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +34, seven [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) skills +28, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +28, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +28

**Int** +8, **Wis** +0, **Cha** +4

**Will** +24 

</column>

---        

The _genius diadem_ is a [_diadem of intellect_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=401) that typically acts like an arrogant professor or mentor, often boasting that it is a certified greater intellect and far superior to your own intelligence, even after the benefits the diadem grants you. The _genius diadem_ encourages you to learn things for yourself rather than actually attempting to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) for you, though you or your allies might be able to play on its arrogance using [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) to trick it into doing so. In addition to allowing you to activate it, the diadem can use the _diadem of intellect’s_ [_hypercognition_](/Spells.aspx?ID=156) activation with its own actions, though if it does so, the diadem gains the benefits instead of you. Only the diadem can use the following activation.

<document level="2" id="action-382" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
